workflow_runs.display_title: Bug 1835689 - don't include cached tasks in existing_tasks for releas…

head_commit.message:
Bug 1835689 - don't include cached tasks in existing_tasks for release promotion (#7412)

* Bug 1835689 - let release promotion hook pass empty rebuild_kinds and do_not_optimize params

Empty lists should be treated as such, not as "use the default value".

* Bug 1835689 - don't include cached tasks in existing_tasks for release promotion

Release promotion reuses tasks generated by the on-push decision task,
to avoid duplicating work.  For cached tasks however, that means reusing
index lookups that can be out of date by the time relpro runs, and
requiring a new push to pick up rebuilt cached tasks.  By listing the
cached kinds in rebuild-kinds, we force new index lookups at release
promotion time, to pick up e.g. new docker images without an extra push.

workflow_runs.name: Glean probe-scraper
workflow_runs.display_title: ci: Use upstream version of `release_artifacts` transforms (#7276)

head_commit.message:
ci: Use upstream version of `release_artifacts` transforms (#7276)

* ci: Add 'mozilla-taskgraph' to Decision task dependencies

* ci: Use upstream 'release_artifacts' transforms

Releng is undertaking an effort to consolidate much of the release logic
that gets copy/pasted from one project to the next. To that end, the
`upstream_artifacts` transforms have been moved to a new
`mozilla-taskgraph` package.

This pull requests adds a dependency on `mozilla-taskgraph 0.1.0` and
removes the `upstream_artifacts` implementation here.

The generate graphs are identical before / after this change.

workflow_runs.display_title: VPN-4707 - Initialize Glean on the iOS network extension (#7085)

head_commit.message:
VPN-4707 - Initialize Glean on the iOS network extension (#7085)

* EXTRA: Move Rust-in-XCode logic to rustlang.cmake

* Add Glean to the network extension target

* Initialize Glean on the network extension

* Make iOS tunnel message handling more robust

+ Create a telemetryEnabled message type

* DETOUR: Create singleton to manage iOS tunnel

* Sync telemetry enabled value with iOS Network Extension

* Update Glean to v53.0.0

* Shutdown Glean on tunnel destruction

This is added to the iOs network extension but not the Android
daemon, because the network extension process is immediatelly
killed when the VPN is turned off. If we want to send a ping
on deactivation it doesn't get persisted unless we wait for
the Glean dispatcher.'

* Address location issue

head_commit.message:
Bug 1774273 - Part (1/2) - Add signingscript macos notarization task (#7044)

MacOS notarization is moving from iscript to signingscript and requires a separate task.

There are no ways of testing notarization outside production. So, this change only adds the notarization task, but DOES NOT affect any other tasks.
The current signing still notarizes, and is treated as source/upstream by the beetmover task

head_commit.message: Add some unit test coverage for connection health (#6948)

Restore qtglean/Cargo.lock (#7026)

Cargo.lock files are required so that a given version of Mozilla VPN
can be rebuilt from the same code.

The NixOS package cannot be built without Cargo.lock, because NixOS
enforces this kind of determinism using a sandbox that disables
network access for builds that don’t have a fixed output hash.

This undoes #6278.  See also #3341, #5236.

Signed-off-by: Anders Kaseorg <andersk@mit.edu>
